column4: hey lads, i need help, my old ubuntu went all over the place with a core file been dumped, so im installing again, WHAT DO I DO TO INSTALL ON A SEPERATE PARTITION ALREADY AND HAVE WINDOWS XP AS A DEFAULT BOOT OS
I WANT TO KEEP WINDOWS, AS DEFAULT WHEN I TURN ON MY COMPUTER, 10 SEC CHOICE MENU
make the windows entry the default, and remove any "savedefault" lines in menu.lst
or keep default=0 and move windows to the top.  usually where you want your default anyway
i dont know how to do that?
edit /boot/grub/menu.lst.  it's just a text file
and what do i type in
what we said.  delete all the lines that say "savedefault" and move the windows entry (which is at the bottom) to the top
the "top" meaning before the line that says BEGIN AUTOMAGIC KERNELS LIST anyway
thanks, whats a god tutorial to get very fimilar with ubuntu
how much linux/unix do you know?
